goal_descEN: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels
target_descEN: Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere
indicator_descEN: Proportion of population subjected to (a) physical violence, (b) psychological violence and (c) sexual violence in the previous 12 months
seriesDescription: Proportion of population subjected to sexual violence in the previous 12 months, by sex (%)
footnotes: "Sexual assault" means individuals who were grabed, touched or assaulted for sexual reasons against their will, include also incidents of rape (sexual penetration)
sources: United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC)

goal_descEN: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels
target_descEN: Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere
indicator_descEN: Proportion of population subjected to (a) physical violence, (b) psychological violence and (c) sexual violence in the previous 12 months
seriesDescription: Proportion of population subjected to sexual violence in the previous 12 months, by sex (%)
footnotes: ["UN-CTS: Sexual assault is defined as an act of a sexual nature carried out against a person's will or without their consent, through the use of physical force, intimidation or coercion and/or involving physical contact. Includes any actual or attempted forced sexual activity such as rape, attempted rape or indecent assault (e.g. being touched inside clothing or intentional rubbing of genitals against the person) and assault with the intent to sexually assault. Includes incidents that occurred at the person's place of work. Excludes sexual harassment that did not involve or lead to an actual sexual assault. For this survey, only persons aged 18 years and over were asked questions about sexual assault. Data relate to 12 months prior to interview. Data are on a financial year basis."]
sources: United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC)

goal_descEN: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels

footnotes: ["UN-CTS: Sexual assault is defined as an act of a sexual nature carried out against a person's will or without their consent, through the use of physical force, intimidation or coercion and/or involving physical contact. Includes any actual or attempted forced sexual activity such as rape, attempted rape or indecent assault (e.g. being touched inside clothing or intentional rubbing of genitals against the person) and assault with the intent to sexually assault. Includes incidents that occurred at the person's place of work. Excludes sexual harassment that did not involve or lead to an actual sexual assault. For this survey, only persons aged 18 years and over were asked questions about sexual assault. Data relate to 12 months prior to interview. Data are on a financial year basis."]
sources: United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC)

goal_descEN: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels
target_descEN: Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere
indicator_descEN: Proportion of population subjected to (a) physical violence, (b) psychological violence and (c) sexual violence in the previous 12 months
seriesDescription: Proportion of population subjected to sexual violence in the previous 12 months, by sex (%)
footnotes: The definiton of Sexual Assault is molesting, harrasing or forcing an individual into comitting sexual action/s. The respondents are requested to inlclude more serious incidents as well as less serious incidents. The reporting period is the calendar year prior to the interview. Incidents of rape are included.
sources: United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC)

goal_descEN: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels
target_descEN: Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere
indicator_descEN: Proportion of population subjected to (a) physical violence, (b) psychological violence and (c) sexual violence in the previous 12 months
seriesDescription: Proportion of population subjected to sexual violence in the previous 12 months, by sex (%)
footnotes: From self-complete module of the survey. Defined as rape or assault by penetration including attempts (serious), indecent exposure or unwanted touching (e.g. touching, grabbing, kissing or fondling) (less serious) carried out by any person.
sources: United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC)
